review: i have been going to chili's for a long time so i decided to try this location. this place is absolutely incompetent in serving food. i went in there with family and for ten minutes there was no one even coming to our table or acknowledging us. there was no reason for this since we were sitting in a fairly well populated area of the restaurant and the restaurant was not busy at the time. the servers completed ignored us and after waiting it out a few more minutes, we walked out. the tables even had the name of the waiters written on them and still this happened. we will never be going here again even if someone else suggests it and i will make sure my family and friends do not ever waste their time with this location. seems like Korey P's and Nikki's assessments were basically what i went through. terrible, just terrible employees and management.

Went over to Chili's for a quick lunch today with my family, had 3, adults, 2 kids, and a teenager.  The service was friendly, but terribly slow.  Our order came out 30-40 min after it was placed and it was clear that it had been sitting on the heat lamps for most of that time.  It was a terrible shame. I have been eating at various Chili's for the last 30 years and this was a particular low point.  If your in the mood for this place, drive over to Sugar Land or go someplace else.

It's a Chili's- not much variation on the food from location to location.  I've come here for a private party and for lunch on many occasions. The service has never really disappointed, nor has there been a long wait for a table or anything negative. There are way better places to eat than Chili's, but for a quick lunch or dinner, it's a good choice.
Service is hit and miss.  About the time I think that this Chili's has finally got their stuff together, then I find that not so much.  Couldn't get them to fill the water glasses, even after asking.
Always say I'll never come back. Gave them another chance and bad as ever. Food just plain sucks. Service wasn't far behind.

"What a happy bunch of people in here", said no one.  EVER About this place.  What horrific service, from the greeter, to the waitress, to a 2nd waitress we nabbed when we could find our own.   Rude, rude and more rude.  Dirty looks, ignoring us, behaving like we asked them the codes to send a missile when we asked for basic things, like, oh, y'know, a knife and fork?  We waited whilst tables were cleaned around us, with no drinks and no one offering to get us any. We also had to ask for refills. The hot rice came out so far ahead of the fajitas that it was cold before my food came. They just handed us hot plates of food, instead of sitting it on the table front of us, which was friggin annoying.  Asked twice to split the check and 1st time she forgot, 2nd time she split into 3! And stood hovering for us to pay, omgggg!  Food was grand, experience was awful.  The staff in this place is a disgrace to the Chilis brand (or at least the 3 we encountered!!) We won't be back, go to the one on Williams trace - much better!

I love Chili's! My menu favorite is the Southwestern Eggrolls, and I really like the service at this location. John the manager is very nice and comes out to ask how everyone's doing often, which I think it just great!  Sometimes the food comes out as perfection, other times not so much, but it's still always great food. I've only had a few sub-par experiences, which is the reason this review isn't five stars. It's the perfect place to meet up with friends and family because it's always busy but not crazy loud. CHILI'S I LOVE YOU.

it's been a while, Chili's!  so, this evening I went in with the parents and found an electronic device called "Ziosk" on each and every table!   Wow! The Ziosk is definitely some hi-tech fun for the kids and teens to play with *wink* and as a matter of fact, it is an easy-to-use system that allows customers to self-order drinks and happy hour items and self-checkout and pay; that way, customers who wish to place orders (bar items only; no entrees) and/ or wanna pay the bills just don't have to wait forever to be helped when the servers are busy!   However, the Ziosk might be creating some laid-back servers.  Why I said that?  Well, my server tonight just kept on telling me to try using the Ziosk while he had been sitting around, chatting with the other servers, and not wanting to work! GrRRRRrrrr that was okay.  I had checked out and paid the bill on the Ziosk successfully.  Teeheee :P Food was alright; service was slow though!  It was the Super Bowl night, and the restaurant was widely empty while just 2 tables in the dining area; yet, we still had to wait quite some time for the foods.  We had requested additional shrimp on the Cajun chicken pasta from the 2 for $20 deal, but were charged extra $2.75 for only 3 seriously small pieces of shrimp, and the chicken was all dried up!  what a rip off!!   Bye Bye now, Chili's.

Hubby and I stopped going here. The food, which was never great, used to be OK, and now it's barely "meh." What really killed it for us, though, is the service. Waitstaff on our last few visits have been rude, inattentive or at best, so over-worked, they barely had time for anyone. The tables and floors are dirty and good luck trying to get your tea or soda refilled. No thank you.

I have no idea why we came back despite our horrible experience last time. I guess we were just too lazy to drive to the SL location like I said we would. Here is what went wrong: -It was EXTREMELY disorganized in the front. The 2 hostesses seemed to have no idea what they were doing. There was a huge wait - about 20 people cramped in the small area in the front of the restaurant. The hostesses seemed to be completely confused on who was next in line. They kept butchering peoples name because they "wrote in crayon". Yes, they said that.  -One of the girls in the front was extremely unwelcoming. She was literally slouched at the podium with her hand on her forehead greeting customers as they were walking in with a very monotone and irritated expression. -We waited 20 minutes to be seated...but there were SO MANY empty tables in the restaurant. Crazy. -Once we were seated, it took THIRTY minutes for them to take our order. -Those little Ziosk tablets on the table only work for (certain) appetizers, drinks, desserts, and paying your bill. It would be nicer if they worked for ordering a meal as well since service was running extremely slow. -The iced tea I got was pretty much sugar with a side of tea. It was gross. -Our server was nonexistent after taking our order. Different servers kept going around asking tables around us if they were doing okay but totally skipped us each time.  -We got half the amount of fries they usually give.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because the food was actually good. The chicken was tender and tasty and the fries were fried to perfection. That being said, it definitely wasn't worth the crappy experience. Next time, for sure, we'll go to the SL location no matter how lazy we feel. It was such a ridiculous experience. Sad to say both times we've experienced the worst service EVER has been at this location of Chilis.

It was late and we were tired, and just needed some food. The food is usually ok, but the service was HORRIBLE!! We have no reason to ever return.  * When we walked in there was no hostess, nobody greeted us and we stood there waiting to be acknowledged for quite some time. Finally a server from the bar came and asked us where we wanted to sit. Yes, as in "Where do you want to sit?" No "Welcome" noting like that.  * Once we were finally seated, the same waitress took our drink order, she was quick with that but the iced tea I got was disgusting. Tasted like dirty dish water. When I complained she said, "Oh yeah, you're not the first person who has complained, must be a bad batch". Would have been nice to know before, or just maybe they could make a new batch??? * We weren't ready to order right away, so she disappeared on us. We asked for "just another minute" and she gave us about 20. During this time while we had nothing else to do, we started to notice all the servers hanging around doing pretty much NOTHING.  * She finally took our order and then disappeared again while we waited a long time for our food. This is getting ridiculous! Once our food came, we must have turned invisible. No service after that at all.  * I had to ask her repeatedly for a box and she didn't even mention the stupid Ziosk (which we already hate!) thing OR offer to bring us a bill, she just was busy talking to her friends. Finally we paid via the Ziosk, and got out of there. I wanted to complain in person to a manager but I couldn't see one (Or any other servers) as we walked out.  Just overall, horrible service. I don't know why anyone would ever go back there (Except maybe for those honey-chipotle chicken crispers). The Ziosk gives the servers an excuse to be even worse than they already are, worst invention ever!!

Typical chain restaurant style food.  Overpriced a bit, but really good, strong service.  They has some sort of wifi-pad thing in which you could use to order a dessert or pay for your meal.  That was cool, tho I wish we could order our entire meal from the pad-thing.

I sat there for about 15 mins while the waitress that was tending to the tables around me just kept walking right past me!  She even looked straight at me several times and not ONCE took my drink order much less my food order!  Finally I just gave up and walked out! I've been here several times before and service was not necessarily great but it surely was NOT this bad!  Needless to say,  that was my last time going there!!!! Extremely poor service all the way around!!

We have always enjoyed grabbing a quick dinner at this location. That is, until tonight. We  were seated at 6:10 and immediately noticed how empty it was. We waited almost 10 minutes to be acknowledged by a server. We placed our orders and then we waited. And waited. And waited. Not once did anyone come to the table to apologize or promise that our food would soon be out. Thirty minutes after sitting down, we went home and ate cheese and crackers.  We couldn't find our server or anyone that appeared to be a manager so we let the hostess know. She asked where we'd been sitting but offered no apology. What's going on with this location?

The moment i stepped inside, something was different. There was no one to greet us and we had to wait for a few minutes before anybody even acknowledged us. It also smelled musty.  I went there for my favorite tostadas and salsa and they were soaking in oil. I asked the server to replace them but it's still the same--- very very greasy. I asked what was wrong and she just said she doesn't know. She took the basket again  and didn't replace it with anything. It was so disappointing since I went there just for the tostadas.  Steak was still good, thank goodness.  Chili's Missouri, I hope you get yourself together next time I come back. I usually give a restaurant a second chance then that's it.

Seems the kitchen is undermining anything positive happening at the front of the house.  When waitstaff report 5 fry cook orders were bad.. it's time to find another fry cook. My fajitas were warm but not sizzling. My wifes order had to be sent back and redone. I would probably skip this location until they solve some pretty fundamental issues.

Okay, the people who gave this 3 stars or more are absolutely crazy. While this may be a good place to just catch a drink for Happy Hour, for lunch or dinner it is totally opposite. Those Ziosk things don't make sense, mine didn't even work! If you are trying to show the world you know technology and want to make it like that, make sure it works!  Another thing, the service. I recall an anecdote when I was 5 or 6 at this exact Chili's and I was crying because the food took forever. The waiters just don't seem to care. They seem like nice people, sometimes at least, but just don't care about this job really. The food takes much longer than any other restaurant. My mom could've driven to Uptown and back and our food still wouldn't have arrived! The food was okay, but you know what satisfies customers? Decoration! I ordered a sirloin with broccoli and mashed potatoes. The broccoli was scattered. Mashed potatoes were a little messy. And the steak had butter all over it. Then a little roll. It looked nothing like what it looked on the menu.  Chili's, you only get 1 star because of your bar. When you sit down, wait a little while before you chow down. That is your motto I think. I felt like I was really claustrophobic and a germaphobe while in there because it was just disgusting. Go there, and be ready to rant about how bad it was on Yelp.

Okay I'm going to explain.   This is a typical chain.  Don't expect "Fine" dining.   They move a lot of food through and it appears the only comments are from people who have a bad experience.  So when I say it's a typical chili's that is what I'm saying.  I've been to chili's in Aiken, SC, Edmonton, AB, Louisville, KY, Hayward, CA, Round Rock,  TX, Cedar Park, TX, Austin, TX,  and Las Vegas, NV.   I'm sure there are others I've forgotten.  Regardless food is okay.   Oops forgot D'iberville, MI.

**UPDATE** They recently did an overhaul in redesigning the restaurant and it looks so great! New lights, lantern chandeliers, chairs, table, walls, paint, everything! I used to work at a different Chili's Restaurant, so I know a few of the operating 'in and outs' of the Brinker Corporation.  Anyway, my point here is not to focus or rave on the food but mainly the staff. I usually come here whenever I take someone to lunch because it's relatively neutral and does have some 'lighter' options for entrees. The lady manager is awesome. She checks up on all the tables, whether lunch or dinner, big or small. The waiters could be a little more attentive but a handful of them are quick, considerate, and are able to read their tables pretty well (special needs, recommending food, etc.). I can't emphasize how much this is a handy tool in the food service industry. Chili's Grill & Bar food is pretty generic. Like I said, my focus here is the management and wait staff. I went last weekend on a date night with my husband and our waitress was very knowledgable of the dishes and drinks. The lady manager was also interested in our experience. Unfortunately I lost the review survey ticket and couldn't leave a proper review. Thanks Chili's - Missouri City wait staff for going above the generic, ordinary and expected experience. Keep it up!

Came in waited few minutes before we sit on our chair. Greeted with a lady waiter. The lady doesn't smile at all -_- she explained how does this "ziosk" work like this one is for lazy waitresses that will not take your bill cause you can pay from it. I ordered tilapia Mango grill and hubby ordered Bacon Burger. Food: overall okay!  Servants: served fine

We arrived here a few mins ago, almost half the place had empty tables (?) but there was a 30 min wait (?) i asked why make all these people wait 30 mins while having so many empty tables... and the girl in front says its bec "their kitchen is backed up" ... SERIOUSLY? this place is too darn big to run like a little taco truck, fire this mgr and get a real one guys cmon lol... No wonder all these one star reviews! We politely cancelled and drove to the Sugarland location less than 10 mins away.

Order some food to go and it was cold and old. Customer service was great but food horrible. I truly believe they gave me someone's left overs. I will never eat there again. Potato skins are just burnt potatoe skins with topping, burger bites the patties are dried out and boneless chicken are dry also and tasted as if they are from yesterday. I normally wouldn't write a review but when I can not eat anything its very sad.
Seriously? An hour wait with open tables and two people waiting in the lobby? Yeah. No. That's unacceptable. Sorry Chili's, you can do better than that.
Got a burger with missing vegetable , Took another 30 min to get one. Poor poor service  Never come back!

Horrible experience.  Bartender served water down drinks and when asked to make a fresh one he wanted to argue, get loud and show me the bottle.  Manager was very helpful in getting the problem resolved.  Server was very slow,  over 40 minutes for the food and then got our order wrong.  Appetizers came out three minutes before the entree.  When the correct order was received the food was flavorful.  The server checked back with us at the end of the meal to ask how was everything.  Really what server disappears after serving a meal?  And when he did appear he walked past us several times and had to get his attention.  The bill arrived with additional Items charged.  Go anywhere but here you will be happier.

This is the first time I've gone to Chilis in years, and it will be the last time. From a corporate perspective, Chilis has gone away from what used to make it great with their most recent menu overhaul. They are trying to be a Ruby Tuesday -- small portions, mediocre food, high prices.  Now, on to the specific feedback for this place. We sat in the bar area on a not-that-busy Saturday night. They serve watered down drinks and while our server was pretty, he wasn't much more than that. I ordered a Captain and Coke and he asked me if I wanted my wine mixed with the Coke, or to serve two separate drinks. Um, what? On top of that, it took forever for him to serve us our food even though we ordered perhaps the most simple of meals (burgers and fajitas).  On top of that, the bartender was super rude. He must forget that he makes the most money when you treat the patrons well since they'll tip you better. Very sad to see that this is the direction Chilis is going, it used to be a solid standby when you were looking for a place for drinks or dinner. Not so much anymore.

Can't believe the ratings for this place............ Service has always been good, drinks are great, and the food is excellent. People need to quit whining about the service and food here. I have been here a few times and will always return. Love it!

The place may be remodeled, but the servers just don't care. You'll be ignored when you walk in. You'll be ignored after you're seated. You'll be ignored after you're served. You could complain, but again they just don't care.
I had dinner on May 22 with my kids. This restaurant is very dirty. No one comes around. Place is not clean. When I walk to rest room, could see employees eating in kitchen. Not coming back. LP

I guess we're the dummies that keep coming back here.  The service is always bad.  The only reason we come back is the kids likes playing with the games that are at the table and my husband like the chips and dip.  The tables near us never were cleaned off and people were waiting on tables.  My food order came out burnt the first time and the second time the order was all wrong.  The women's room didn't have paper towels and I mentioned that when we got there and washed our hands and when we left a hour later, still no paper towel and the tables around us still had dirty dishes and people still waiting to seat down.  So here we go again going through the same stuff.  I will say I do like the mini burgers when they don't burn them.

I keep giving this location another chance and they always disappoint. Its less than 2 minutes away from work and sometimes I just crave it or a coworker does but never again! I came here on Thursday on my lunch break with my coworker. I picked it because I had some points on their rewards program so I was going to get a free lunch combo. We ordered the new appetizer-white queso.. it was pretty good. My soup came with no spoon.. the waiter was always disappearing so by the time I could ask for a spoon, my food came out. No point in eating the soup and letting my food go cold. Food was ok, typical chili's. The part that made me mad was the whole paying on that stupid machine.  Not only did it not let me use my points to pay, it wasn't able to split to check which it clearly stated that it could. There's a "split check" button but it wouldnt do it. I had to flag a manager down and he just went back to the old way and swiped it on his computer.  It's always something with this location. I just can't anymore

I use yelp a lot because I travel, but I had not ade an account until just now. Yep, I made an account to rate this Chilis. It is near our house and we have been here a number of times. Not again. Living in Missery City you quickly get accustomed to indifferent service. Tonight, this Chilis went above and beyond in underwhelming service. My wife arrived before the kids and I, and had been sitting for a while when we got there. Many minutes later the waiter arrived and suggested we switch sections, as the brain dead host was sitting everyone in his section. Ok. Nope, no better with 3 servers strolling around and non one stopping to take our drink order. I left a dollar for the tea my wife was able to get and we left. Good bye Chilis. Your food is neither bad nor memorable, but your service is terrible. A number of other reviewers hit it- they just don't care. But then again, that's what you get when your labor force is Missouri City.

Chili's has just became my go to to-go place.  It was 6:40pm and I had wasted about 15 minutes idling in our car looking at another restaurant's menu, only to find out that restaurant was closed down. So I had to do a quick search around the area and find something that didn't have "Donald's" or "fil-A" in its name. Those who have young kids understand. So one glance at the chili pepper and I was sold. I looked at their online menu (which was well-designed btw) and ordered over the phone. Service was quick, courteous, and to the point in helping me order. They said it will be done in 20 minutes. Food was piping hot and ready to go when I walked through the door.  Everything smelled so good and I was getting hungrier by the minute, even my wife (who was sick at the time) commented on how it smelled so good. The surprise is when I came home and I bit into the classic bacon burger. OH MY. Were my taste buds lying to me? I bought the burger off the cuff, thinking its a safe choice. But I didn't expect this to be that delicious. The patty was perfectly seasoned, juicy, and packed with freshness. This is maybe a half step down from Guru, but oh man, everything from the applewood smoked bacon, melted sharp cheddar cheese, fresh lead lettuce and the Chili's signature sauce, was absolutely perfect. It was so fresh, not what I'm accustomed to from a chain (and a to go order)! We also had the Dinner for $20, which was a steal. We had the chicken Cajun pasta which definitely made our taste buds dance more. I'm used to eating bland, dense, and sometimes overcooked chicken breasts on my pasta. However, the chicken was excellent, juicy, tender, and not dense at all. The pasta and sauce was just a bit overseasoned, but I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing. And that was because the Texas fries appetizer was so huge. Were we hungry? Yes. Did we get this to go? Yes. Was the service good at the to-go area?  Prompt and courteous, everything packed well and ready. Was the food good? It was not only good, but so good that it made me long to eat it again as leftovers.

Went on a Sunday evening, it was not busy.   The hostess seated us right away.  The waitress came over soon after we sat.    We ordered the cheese bites and queso and chips for appetizers.   I liked the cheese bites. , mostly the dipping sauce.  The cheesy bites are very salty and many will not be able to eat them. The queso has chili in it.  It is different and I love it.   We both had the baby back ribs.  Fall apart tender.  Love those ribs! The food came out pretty quickly, and the wait staff kept our glasses full. I'll go back.

Although I didn't like the southwest chicken soup that i had yesterday and the fries were not fresh, they looked old, but i still give this place 5 stars.  Because their service was good and caring and responsible.  They didn't charge us the soup that i didnt eat.  Me and my boyfriend had fun when played games on their tablet (i think).  The dessert is good.  The manager and the waitress were super nice. I think they are trying to improve themselves. So y'all so give them a chance and a try. :)

Dec 29th I ordered a full size order of Texas cheese fries & a skillet chocolate chip cookie to-go and they left chives on my fries and the cashier got mad when I asked if she could please remove them or make me a new batch, also the chocolate chip cookie was stale and it taste old, I called to speak to the manager and he said I was going to get reimbursed money to my credit card for my awful food service but they just lied. Never coming back to this restaurant again. People always seem to have a bad attitude there. Not a recommended place to eat.

Is it even possible to give this place no starts at all?! Who's running this place and why do I keep coming back? The service is always terrible but this time takes the cake! My server is dry and irritable and my appetizer tasted like maybe the bottom of the pot had burned. Would not ever send anybody here.  1.16.16

Do not come here if you are on an 1 1/2 lunch. There was a teacher inservice today & this restaurant obviously doesn't check the school district calendar. They were completely overwhelmed & we ended up having to take our food to go to make it back to school on time. Not to mention there were 8 fries on my plate.

Each time we come to this place we always say it is the last time. Now we are hands down NEVER going back.  They take forever to acknowledge you and then when they do they get posses off because you are bothering them. We went and they brought out our food before the apps and salads. This kid bartender was so rude saying what you don't want it? He was so rude I told him no I don't want it and asked to pay for our 2 drinks. Then this lazy man with a limp that we always see (doing nothing) comes up to us rude as can be and says "You all want to talk to me?" I said who are you? He said "I am the Manager." I explained we did not want to speak with him we wanted to pay and leave. He was just as rude and yelled at the bartender to get our check so we can "get out." I could not believe his response. There was a girl cleaning a table that worked there and said that he is always like that. Shame on him! Remember there are many places to eat in Sugar Land and Mo City. We will not return to that one again!

What a pleasant surprise! Hubby and I have not been here in at least 6 months because the last 2 times we've been here the service was so bad, the tea had a sour, dirty taste and the food was just okay. Today we decided to give it another try because we were at Home Depot right next door and we were starving.  When we walked in the door there was a hostess there to greet us. That's never happened before. In fact the last time we were here, we watched several people leave without eating because we waited so long for someone to seat us. This time we were seated quickly and our waitress arrived at our table within a minute to take our drink orders. She brought us our tea that tasted freshly brewed and kept our glasses filled throughout our meal. After ordering our food, it was delivered to our table piping hot in a reasonable amount of time. The corn on the cob was sweet and juicy and the black beans had a nice spicy kick that made my mouth tingle. My honey chipotle chicken crispers were perfectly fried and had plenty of the sauce over them for once. Hubby's mashed potatoes and cream gravy were good, but the real star of the show was his chicken fried steak. It's a new item on the menu and after the waitress recommended it, he decided to give it a try. The hand breaded steak had just enough crispy coating and was so tender it almost melted in your mouth! Hubby said its the best CFS that he's had in years. That's quite a compliment because he usually doesn't get too excited about restaurant food. I had plenty of food of my own, but I kept sneaking bites of his steak because it was so good.  I don't know if this location has a new manager or what, but things have definitely changed. Hope they keep doing what they are doing. The service was excellent, the food was great and we will be back!

This place is AWFUL!!!!! Incredibly rude wait staff and I have literally sat at the bar,  waiting to pick up an order, for twenty minutes before even being acknowledged. Now I'm trying to pay for a to-go order over the phone and after four attempts of calling they will not answer.  Corporate needs to come in and do a major sweep, as well as better training. My dog can run this place more efficiently.

Very disappointed in the terrible service. My husband and I came in for a late dinner and were ignored for 15 minutes. When I stopped a server for assistance we were again ignored 5 more minutes. We then left and no one noticed or cared. We won't be back!

Service here on a Sunday just after 11am started out good, there were only two other tables in the bar area. The bartender who waited on us was more concerned with drinking her Starbucks than writing down our order. We ordered the $35 Dinner for 2, got some weak margaritas, really good onion rings, 1/2 rack of ribs, and the Mango Chile Tilapia(We actually received the Mango Chile Chicken but didn't want to wait for it to be remade). I have worked in many restaurants and there is a reason you write down the order, she had to come back and ask questions. We got a dessert, Classic Molton Chocolate Cake, delicious, and the Fried Cheese Curds, highly recommend those.  Food was good, but these days, service is lacking everywhere. When we asked the host at the front if they had all day Happy Hour, he said "I don't know, I'm new". Wtf? Why didn't he say, "Let me find out for you". The trash can outside was overflowing and those are host duties, as well as opening the door for guests. He just stood there the whole time. The rest of the servers hung out in a booth near us talking about their weekend instead of helping in the kitchen, cleaning, and running food. The manager did not seem to care, he never came to our table to ask how we were, he was busy handing raffle tickets to his servers for his kid, watching the game, and playfully throwing towels at the bartender. No manager I have ever worked for would do that, they always say "If you've got time to lean, you've got time to clean". Which is the way it should be in restaurants, everybody works as a team to give the guests a good experience.   We waited 10-15 minutes after finishing our dessert for our check while our bartender finished her Starbucks. We only came here because we had a gift card, I will be regifting it if we ever get it again. If you come here, order Togo food, and get out of there.

The food was good ! Actually the only reason they get a 4 star , is because of new staff being trained. With that being said , the manger waited on us and everything was great!also I watched her explaining how to do this with a employee. Next time I'm sure the will get a 5.

I'm usually game for Chili's food with the BIG exception of this location!!!! Given them three chances, over a course of two years and service has consistently sucked. Simple things like straws, napkins are simply forgotten. The molten chocolate cake is dry and not served warm. And the list goes on and on.... You get the point!!! We've only ever gone back for the convenient location but won't be bothering anymore.

Terrible to-go service. If I could give it 0 stars I would. The restaurant is run by a bunch of high schoolers. There is absolutely no professional oversight. The food orders (size and taste) vary from one day to the next. This time around I ordered chilies original chicken crispers and the size of the crispers came as the size of McDonald's McNuggets. I also ordered a sunrise burger and received an ultimate burger instead. I have gotten my ordered wrong here way too many times and will never come back here again.

When I was a small child, Chili's used to be a regular destination for me and my family, but now that times are changing and restaurant chains are no longer "cool" to go to, I haven't visited Chili's too many times recently, either. While it is true that many American restaurant chains have grown too large in size and have menus that are too expensive to be able to guarantee high food quality, Chili's is still an okay place to visit once in a while. Admittedly, Chili's isn't the best value, and doesn't serve the highest quality food, but some of their lunch specials come at a decent price, and the size of their menu makes it a fair choice for family dinners.  My favorite thing on the menu is easily the original chicken crispers, which are coated in a unique batter that is lighter and crispier as opposed to more crunchy breadcrumb-coated chicken fingers you typically find at restaurants. At over $10 plus tip for the meal, though, I can't say the chicken is better than Raising Cane's in any way. I tried the ultimate bacon on my last visit, and was neither surprised nor disappointed with how the burger came out. The toppings saved an otherwise overcooked burger from disaster, and the sauces and bacon added enough salt and moisture to make the burger acceptable. The bun was tougher than I expected, but no to the point I would call it stale. I do like the quesadillas here, since they are stuffed with a lot of cheese and griddled with plenty of oil to make the tortillas crisp.  Chili's most recent promotion has been their grass-fed burgers and their $10 burger meal deal, and while these promotions did in part attract me to revisit Chili's, I didn't try either one of them. If Chili's is trying to make itself known for its burgers, I would at least suggest making sure they are cooked to order. While it is certainly difficult for a large chain like Chili's to truly make any major changes, I do feel that the growth of the company has over the years caused a decline in overall food quality.

When I got here, there was no one to greet me or seat me. I stood for what seemed like eternity (2 minutes) then finally I sat at the bar.   Great bartender.  Not only did he serve me my drink that I ordered but gave me a general recipe so that I can make it at home.   Yummy!!!!

Sad, sad sad... This place has gone down!!! We go everytime hoping it will make a comeback. We decided to meet here for dinner after work. It was so bad my husband walked out before I could get there and he never complains. He said it was no one there to greet him at the bar. The bar and the tables were dirty and it looked deserted. So sad too bad. So close to home and a waste of retail space.

Jeez Louise this service is excruciatingly slow. My server Danielle kept coughing into her hand while carrying utensils and plates. I have so much more to say but won't. I only came because someone gave me a gift card.god I have been here forever to get this check! Never again!

I waited 15 minutes when I first arrived to be served. Nobody even addressed me. I had to address them. I came in already noticing one woman commenting on how long she was waiting. A manager in a green shirt was who I asked was she a bartender or can she take my order. She had a slight attitude telling me she will help me when she is done helping others. I told her I had been waiting long and so have others and she still didn't immediately help us. I asked where the bartender was she said "right there"... ummm.. is she going to come over and serve us.. Then as the manager in the green shirt took my order she had a attitude, even rolled her eyes.. Guess she thought giving me a free 10oz steak would make up for this horrible service. No this is ridiculous! Then I got my good after waiting 20 minutes. Good thing it was free right. I didn't know it took 20min to cook a streak. I've cook many steaks and even well done doesn't take that long. Good thing it tasted good. Then while I waited for a refill on my water I could hear and see the bartender manager and other employees in the kitchen talking about what someone did and said and how she reacted and blah blah blah while I'm wanting a simple water refill. Smh chilis y'all need to get it together! Horrible experience and I chose to come here over Applebee's.. what was I thinking?
Food was pretty good. Would have been better if they didn't burn the cheese in my jalapeño cheddar sausage.  Good service.
We've given several months and tried again for late night dinners and thankfully it has improved much in comparison to time's past

Services isn't what you are expecting after a long week of working and all you want is to have a nice server.  This a joke, to be seated and wait and wait and wait... without been offer not even water (when I am ready to order my food)  I had to get up of my table to go asked if anyone could take our order( just two people) but there was a group of five employees just chatting and not taking care of their business.  It was actually my first time at this place and I'm 100% sure that it was my last one.

The quality of service has consistently deteriorated in the last 6 months or so. We went in a week ago on a Friday night; another couple walked in at the same time we did and the hostess literally just looked at us, with no move or attempt to seat, I later watched her hang off the hostess stand, seemingly bored to tears. We sat in the bar area, ordered our food and waited over 30 minutes for tacos and a sandwich order. When I asked the runner why it took so long, they said it was because the dining area of the restaurant was busy. We have worked in restaurants before so we have an idea of how service should work in one and busy or not, there isn't much reason in a Chili's for a taco plate and chicken sandwich to take almost 40 minutes to come out, with no communication from the server or manager or anyone else. I watched the hostess hang off the hostess stand, seemingly bored to tears. Oh and now they've got the presidente margarita 'on tap' and it's horrible, but now they'll upcharge you a few dollars to get them to hand make it like they used to, with the good tequila. Shoddy, Chili's! Another place to get a drink and a nosh in Missouri City bites the dust; it's becoming quite the pain to have to leave the city and go to Sugarland when you want to hang out and relax.

There was a roach behind my head and it flew under the table. The server was very nice and offered to trade our table, bur our appetite was completely gone!!! The bad bodied manager with the red hair and the glasses had the nerve to tell us it was normal to have roaches flying around because the door opens and closes all day!!!! Have they ever heard of roach spray or roach traps !!!! The manager finally came out and had the nerve to tell us we had to still pay for one drink, are you freaking kidding me !!

This location has notoriously had bad service.  So when my daughter chose here "for the chips" I gave in because my daughter is so sweet- but NEVER again- We order chips and salsa, and they say they are out of chips....................so we wait...........................and wait................................and wait......................server comes over and says "I don't know what the deal is but there aren't going to be any chips soon" so I tell him to go ahead and cancel those and check on our food order.  He walks away and the server helping the table next to us sets down..........................wait for it.................YES freaking chips and salsa.  What the what?  So several minutes pass and I flag down my guy and ask him what's up...he tells me..."well you cancelled your order- if you want to talk to the manager she is right there" (at the table 3 behind me apologizing for the slow service).  I tell him, dude no just bring me my chips and salsa.............10 minutes later he returns with chips and salsa and says "don't worry that won't be on your bill" OMG like I was worried that 45 minutes after I sit down that the chips that I ordered 40 minutes ago finally get there and you act like your doing me a favor...I hate this place I hate it- I will not go back ever- and people stop going there and close all of these places down as they just need to focus on Macaroni Grill and let Chili's die the horrible death it deserves.  And whatever I ordered sucked as well- a burger of some fashion I ended up pulling the meat out and eating only that cuz the rest sucked.......and Chili's I hate you! You are DEAD to me.....................Dead. Survey question 1 good for .................NOTHING

location: The Shops At Riverstone, Missouri City, TX
review: Just plain terrible, been sitting here for an hour waiting on my food and I've only been refilled ONCE!! Only 5 tables in this restaurant and still bad service.

I used to come to Chilis & love their Texas cheese fries ! But now when I came here for them again, they changed completely. The cheese is this fake chewey consistency & everything is melted together like glue and it isn't how it used to be.

Surprisingly, I had some amazing margaritas and quite decent food here! I haven't been to a Chili's in at least 10 years. I only came here on a request from a relative. We came here on a Tuesday evening for dinner for a party of 6. There were not many patrons in the restaurant. The service was friendly, but slow. Two of us got the special deal they have where 2 eat for $33. and it was a great deal! Most of the food is fried, which isn't my type of food, but overall I'm going to have to say that I was pleasantly surprised with the Margaritas and food this time.

When you enter a restaurant to eat the last thing you want to see is TRASH everywhere - on the floor - the tables - the entire bar area - I can understand if the place is slammed and no one has the time - but when the bar tender is standing there and staff is just walking around - it's unacceptable - I'm not sure what the issue was or is , but someone should be accountable to come by every 10/15 minutes and pick up the tables and floors . Just food for thought - and I will not be dining at your establishment again. Only reason we stayed my daughter was heart bent on eating chilis and was starving. I took a video of a lot more - not posting for some reason - but if corporate wants to see - I can email it -

Table was dirty. When the waitress finally came after about 10 minutes, she said 'oh, I need to clean this table'.  She walked away and came back with a dry napkin and 'dusted' the table off. Then she left for 10 more minutes. I had to go to the bar and order drinks, and later ask for water.  I ordered a rum neat and a corona margarita. The bartender told the the waitress to charge me for a double.  The margarita had no alcohol in it.  Never coming back.

Terrible service and the hostess will ignore you completely while you stand there. The bar area is equally as rude and they can't make a drink properly at all. How can they keep hiring managers that can't keep employees in check. Bad attitudes make such a bad dining experience! I've been going there for over 16 years and I'm done with this place.

Went for lunch Sunday around 1pm - party of 5. Sat at the table for 15 minutes and never saw a waiter/waitress. Asked the hostess, and she said they were short handed, so we left because if that is the way service is going to be, then I'd rather not.
